Text.Page: Elleon is looking for <PCNAME> to discuss what to do next.
<PCNAME> met Vogzu, the leader of Free Exodor. an organization founded to stand against the Draakons. Vogzu suggests that <PCNAME> and the Nagas help each other.

The villagers are safe now. Thank you . But there's still more people trapped someplace.

We need to find them all and stop Exodor.

The villagers and Titus already headed up. We should follow them.

It won't work.

It's impossible to move so many people. You should know that.

I need to talk to Elleon. I have to know what he's thinking. With so many people, it's just a matter of time before we get caught.

If Elleon thinks that rescuing people is more important than putting an end to Exodor, I need to say that I'm good without him."Calm down."

You're right...I am so frustrated. I can't stand to look at Elleon's face right now.

Can you go to Elleon and ask what he's thinking?

I can understand Titus's frustration.

But my priority is to secure the civilians. I should make this clear.

We should gather up, and I'll have a word with everyone.

All right, splitting up sounds like a good plan.

Titus, Amarre, and Aurl should look for a safe place the villagers can stay.

In the meantime, you and I will follow Jelena and see if there are any villagers left behind.

We should take flares so we can keep in touch.

Let's move. Quick.

, look. It's a mark from Jelena.

We'll catch up with her in no time if we search the area ahead for more marks.

Wow, you caught up faster than I expected.

Take a look over there. Looks like someone's captured, right?

That's definitely not a naga. It's one of our people. But wait...there's a captured naga too? That's strange...

Anyway, Elleon and I will find out if there are more people to save. I'll leave this bunch to you, .

Could it be...? !!

Thank you so much! I never thought I'd be saved by you.

The first nagas we met here were different from the nagas that captured us.

They helped us a lot before you came.

Thank...you...It's quite surprising to see a stranger who wasn't captured.

Our best way out of here is for you to defeat these nagas in the Scout Camp.

Then, head south from the Scout Camp and down and you'll reach my village. The villagers are cautious. Signal as you enter, and I shall meet you there.

Let me introduce myself. My name is Regarn. I'm a member of Free Exodor, a resistance force against the draakons.

Vogzu, our leader, is waiting for you with your companions.

Come, follow me.
You saved our people and taught those Azart scumbags a lesson! Thank you.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"What happened?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

This place is home for the Rosema tribe and also one of Free Exodor's hideouts.

Just like the other nagas, we were forced to this place with orders to take care of the Murderwings and Mournwings.

Just before you arrived, Rogash came to take our people to use as his experimental objects...he even slaughtered our people who refused to.

Those damn draakons...they always think of us as their slaves. That's why I founded Free Exodor.

We pretend to follow their orders...but we're doing everything we can to stand against them.

My only wish is to free all the nagas and leave this place."What do you want?"

I realized that we could help each other when I saw you fighting with Rogash's men.

I know why you're here.

You wish to stop Exodor, right?

I haven't seen it for myself, but there's an engine in the Dark Fortress that runs Exodor."Where's the Dark Fortress?"

The Dark Fortress is in the deepest place of this skycastle.

I can help you get there."Where are the villagers?"

You won't find them here. They're at the other side.

If you don't hurry, they'll be used as Lumikan's and Rogash's experiments ."What should I do?"

Do what you must do.

Go east and you'll find a Free Exodor Camp.

Help our people there. I give you my word that you'll get help as well in return.

I never thought I'd get help from a stranger. Thanks, Vogzu!

But Rogash got your people...? That's horrible...
